Title: Principles of Machine Tools
Author: অমিতাভা ভট্টাচার্য
Summary: The purpose of this treatise is to present a systematic treatment of the theory of metal cutting and basic underlying principles of machine tool design so as to unveil the basic fundamentals in a small concise textbook. No attempt has been made to incorporate thumb-rules. Emphasis has always been placed on the logical analysis, without elaborating irrelevant details. The authors have laid stress on giving the up-to-date information on the researches carried out throughout the world in this field, with suitable references to encourage the students to go through the original monumental works of the acknowledged leaders in this area-Zoka, Loladye, Loenigsbcrges and others. The speciality of the treatise, by and large, is in the inclusion of illustrative examples and problems for classroom exercise. It has been designed to formalise the course structure in the format of a textbook. At the end, a few typical syllabi have been included to illustrate how the treatise covers a given course outline. Overall, a must for those interested in Machine Tools.

Title: MCQ's in Pharmacology
Author: এ. ডব্লিউ. ভাগাট
Summary:
In order to learn the basic information about Pharmacology a medical student must turn
to a standard textbook of Pharmacology. However, the purpose of these Multiple Choice
Questions is to encourage the reader to detect areas of weakness in his understanding of
the subject matter, so that he can go through his text for a more comprehensive study.
While framing these questions, it is presumed that the student has basic knowledge about
the subject and stress is given only on those aspects which the student is likely to miss
or underestimate while going through the text. The questions will provide an interesting
challenge to the student and will give him an opportunity to improve his skills with
Multiple Choice Questions.
